1.title: What is Internet Safety?
1.text:
Internet safety means protecting your personal information and avoiding online threats while using websites, apps, and digital services.
Staying cyber safe helps you protect your identity, devices, and privacy from cybercriminals.

2.title: Protect Passwords
2.text:
Strong passwords are your first defense. Use a mix of uppercase, lowercase, numbers, and symbols. Avoid using names or birthdays. Use a password manager to remember them.

Example of a strong password: Jk#7x@Pz!2lq
Weak password: john123

3.title: Beware of Phishing
3.text:
Phishing is when attackers trick you into giving personal info by pretending to be someone else (e.g., your bank or school).

Watch out for:
- Misspelled URLs
- Urgent or threatening language
- Suspicious attachments

Tip: Never click unknown links or download random files.

4.title: Cyberbullying
4.text:
Cyberbullying includes hurtful messages, harassment, and threats online.

If you or someone you know is being bullied:
- Do not respond
- Save evidence
- Block the bully
- Report it to trusted adults or platforms

5.title: Secure Social Media
5.text:
Keep your profiles private. Avoid sharing:
- Your location
- Daily routines
- Personal details like school or workplace

Update your privacy settings and be selective with friend requests.

6.title: Avoid Malware
6.text:
Malware is software designed to harm your device. It can steal info or damage files.

Avoid malware by:
- Not downloading pirated software
- Avoiding pop-up ads
- Using antivirus software
- Keeping your system updated

7.title: Safe Browsing
7.text:
Look for the lock symbol in the address bar before entering any personal info.

Avoid unsafe websites, especially those with:
- Too many pop-ups
- 'You have won!' messages
- Sketchy downloads

Use reputable browsers and enable security settings.

8.title: Two-Factor Auth (2FA)
8.text:
2FA adds a second step when logging in. A code usually sent to your phone or an app.

Even if someone has your password, 2FA can stop them from getting in.

Always enable 2FA on email, banking, and social media accounts.

9.title: Spotting Online Scams
9.text:
Scammers use messages or fake ads to trick you into sending money or info.

Common scams include:
- Fake job offers
- 'You have won' lotteries
- Tech support imposters

Always verify before trusting. If it is too good to be true, it probably is.

10.title: Online Etiquette
10.text:
Being kind and respectful online matters. Follow these tips:
- Think before you post
- Don't overshare
- Avoid using ALL CAPS
- Respect others' opinions

Digital footprints last. Post responsibly.
